issues.description: The template’s Farm.java file defines and nests a class named AnimalFarm instead of defining the expected public class Farm (file name Farm.java should contain class Farm). This prevents students from implementing and referencing Farm as described in the problem and shown in the solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the class in Farm.java from AnimalFarm to Farm (matching the file name) and remove duplicate or nested class definitions so that Farm.java defines exactly one public class Farm.

issues.description: The template stub for singFarmSongVerse in Farm.java omits the Animal parameter (“private void singFarmSongVerse(/*Animal animal*/)”), whereas the problem statement and solution expect singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal).
issues.suggested_fix: Change the signature of singFarmSongVerse in the template to include the Animal parameter: private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal).

issues.description: The template defines the farm class as AnimalFarm, while both the problem statement and the solution repository refer to it simply as Farm. Students looking for a class named Farm (and using Main’s `new Farm()`) will be unable to map the requirement to the provided template, causing compilation errors and confusion.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the class AnimalFarm in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Farm.java to Farm to match the problem statement and solution, and update any references (e.g., in Main.java) accordingly.
